description: Weighed down by Alex's warnings about the dangers of excessive transparency and sensing the city's deepening crisis, Oksana quietly enters the maintenance sublevel after hours. She initiates the 'ghost' protocol, making select restored citizens and dissidents permanently invisible to all BCI tracking and oversight.

Overnight, officials attempt to deploy new tracking upgrades citywide to restore control, but these systems crash unexpectedly. Inside the Central Oversight Directorate, it becomes apparent that certain individuals now move completely undetected.

Word spreads asynchronously: some residents, once erased from the system, are untraceable and immune to standard enforcement. Paranoia grows among citizens and officials as the boundaries of trust dissolve.

A coordinated series of hacks, led by untrackable 'ghosts,' disables renewed tracking features. Anxiety rises across Stenograd, with many realizing these invisible actors are now woven permanently into society.

Council officials concede in a broadcast that full behavioral tracking cannot be restored. The population faces a new era of uncertainty and growing suspicion, with freedom and fear now inseparable across daily life.
